meanings.definition: Corresponding sounds at the ends of words, often used in poetry.
meanings.sent1: In the poem, the rhyming made the verses sound musical.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed writing poems with rhyming words at the end of each line.
meanings.sent3: The rhyming in the song made it easy to remember the lyrics.
meanings.sent4: The rhyming of the birds' chirps and the rustling leaves created a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent5: The rhyming of the bells echoed through the quiet town.

meanings.definition: The act of creating rhymes in writing or speech.
meanings.sent1: His talent for rhyming made his poems popular among friends.
meanings.sent2: During the poetry slam, she showcased her skill in rhyming.
meanings.sent3: The rhyming contest at the school fair brought out the creativity in students.
meanings.sent4: The rhyming of his jokes always brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her rhyming in the rap battle impressed the judges.
